thread.title: Hillary Clinton Enters The Scene Again – Set To Speak At Georgetown University
thread.title_full: Hillary Clinton Enters The Scene Again – Set To Speak At Georgetown University

author: Charles Campbell
title: Hillary Clinton Enters The Scene Again – Set To Speak At Georgetown University
text:
Clinton Supporter And Media Matters Founder Suffers Heart Attack 
The institute’s executive director Melanne Verveer, who also served as Clinton’s chief of staff during her time in the White House, indicated she is looking forward to hosting her old colleague. 
“We’re delighted to welcome her back to Georgetown to address an issue she has long championed,” Verveer said. 
The former secretary of state will talk about “the important role that women can play in international politics and peace building efforts.” Advertisement - story continues below 
“Secretary Clinton has been a strong advocate for the role of women in peace processes as an important means to end hostilities and achieve sustainable peace,” read a statement from Georgetown. 
Before making a reappearance, Clinton has spent most of her post-election time at her home in Chappaqua, N.Y. 
She told a crowd in Scranton, Pa. on St. Patrick’s Day that she’s “ready to come out of the woods and to help shine a light on what is already happening around kitchen tables, at dinners like this, to help draw strength that will enable everybody to keep going.” 
“I’m like a lot of my friends right now, I have a hard time watching the news,” she added. Advertisement - story continues below
